< name>
kaitlin kelly<//name>
<rating>5</rating><GmapID>0x80c2ba173bf4a0e5:0x1e3ac6e0fde2e688< /GmapID>< Text>
After two pregnancies and breast feeding for about 3 years my body was in need of some TLC. Holden was very warm and personable and made what can be an awkward situation (being half naked under a little sheet) a comfortable and relaxing experience.  I had sprained my back several months earlier and was unsure if I even needed to be "fixed" (as it had more or less healed) but I had some tension in my neck and shoulders and still would feel tingling in my back on occasions. My husband has known Holden for many years now and would always return from his visits with him as if he had seen a miracle worker! I finally decided it was my turn for a change.  Holden gave me a short assessment and pointed out that not only was my neck locked up but my left hip was locked and three ribs were out of place.  Oh the joys of having children! I left MetaTouch feeling loose, relaxed and refreshed.  I would definitely recommend anyone to pay them a visit!< /Text>

<UserId.>103241387733557061919<//UserId.><date>1565019927922<//date>< Review>
I feel like a rabbit (in the best way) when I eat here. If you're like me (too lazy to make a dang salad, on occasion), this place is excellent. I've tried most of the salad toppings and everything is always very fresh. My boyfriend says their tri-tip sandwiches are "amazing", though I can't personally vouch for them. The rosemary focaccia bread that is added to salad orders is very good. I always wind up wanting more than the seven toppings that come with a large salad order (and I'm never able to finish a large salad by myself), but wanting more of what you see at a restaurant is never a bad thing. Go here if you really like a tasty, filling salad.< /Review>

< date>
1549303502462< /date>
< pictures>
None</pictures>
<Response>None< /Response><Rate>4<//Rate><Text>Great salads and more.

Plutos has a large salad bar.  You select your size (small is more than enough for one person) and lettuce type, along with seven toppings.  I've always had good luck with the quality of lettuce and toppings.  They will offer your choice of steak or chicken to add also.  Turkey can be had on request.  The meats are hit and miss.  I usually just go for the salads sans the meat.

They also have sides like mashed potatoes with a gravy that is really good, and a sandwich bar in which they'll slice fresh turkey or tri-tip and make it into delicious sandwiches.

Logistics of ordering are a little confusing since the salad and sandwich and sides bar have separate lines.  People are unclear on how to behave if you are ordering from multiple locations and whether you have to stand in each line separately.

Overall good food and healthy, too!< /Text>< gmapID>
0x80852972dd12ed59:0x4b91071e9f6de5a<//gmapID>

<review>Plutos is just an amazing place to eat at. What really blew my mind the first time that I came here was the way in which you ordered your food. You select from a menu that they have for you in the front and you go from station to station, picking out what you want to eat and they prepare it for you on the spot. They always have different specials each week and if you are a daredevil, then go ahead and pick something random from their weekly specials. Their prices MAY seem a bit too excessive but trust me, they pile food on your plate as if it will be your last meal of your life. Sometimes there is trouble finding a table since it is always packed but it doesn't take off too much of the general atmosphere that it creates. Definitely one of the best places to eat  in Davis, guaranteed.</review><GmapID>0x80852972dd12ed59:0x4b91071e9f6de5a<//GmapID>< date>
1319108577324< /date>

< Review>
E≈çS Fitness is honestly the worst gym experience ever. I signed up for short term personal training under the expressed assurance that the gym would accommodate me and my unique situation. I work an international job and was only set to be in the States for a few months.

Therefore, I only needed a few sessions and was told repeatedly that I would only be charged for four sessions by Katie, who signed me up.

I admit that I misunderstood the contract at first, not realizing each session was $148, but after caving, I decided to finish all four sessions. I then asked Katie and her team to cancel my membership and ensure that I would not be charged again. They pulled my name up on their system and reassured me.

This was in March. Fast forward to June, and my account was charged yet AGAIN, even though I have no intention on returning to the gym and I leave the country in two weeks.

EOS has not responded to any of my inquiries, they refuse to give me written confirmation of this cancellation, and overall they have made me feel like a PRISONER to their company.

My bank is in dispute with them currently and one can only hope this repeated issue is resolved. I sincerely hope no one else is put through the emotional anguish I experienced. Please invest your money in another gym, like Planet Fitness. EOS is a greedy corporation.< /Review>

< name>

< Rating>
2< /Rating>
< Text>
To be fair, I found the staff to be friendly and eager to help.  I hold nothing against this gym in particular, but I do have an issue with the customer service structure.
If you are going to get a membership here just do so knowing that in the event something doesn't work out as planned there is absolutely no one who can assist you.  All policies are set forth by Gold's Gym Corporate...or at least that is what you are told. So then I called the Member Services number given to me.  Member Services implies...well...service.  Come to find out Member Services is merely what they call their billing agency.  A third party with absolutely no authority to take into account individual situations and weigh them on a case by case basis.  At this point I was referred to Gold's Gym Corporate, because they make the rules.  Call Gold's Gym Corporate, and after an exhausting conversation get referred to none other then my local gym because it is a franchise gym, and therefor abides by it's own rules.
By this point I am exhausted, ready to just say screw the entire thing and go with L.A. Fitness.  No contract and they have better extras.
I would beg you to take caution prior to signing an agreement with any Gold's Gym. If anything goes wrong you will spend days just trying to get a hold of some one who can't help.</Text>

< Review>
I have an amazing experience everytime I step foot into an eos gym. It doesn‚Äôt matter where or who is working. I get a ‚Äúwelcome‚Äù when I walk in and a ‚Äúhave a nice day‚Äù when I leave. They are genually there to help everyone reach their fitness goal. I have never felt judged or ‚Äúunworthy‚Äù to be in this gym. They offer free advice (which I think we all can appreciate). They offered to take my measurements for free üòÑ that was the best part! I could see where I was in my fitness journey! I learned where I want to be and how far I need to go. Normally having someone measure your body is uncomfortable for everyone but it was done with a lot of respect and in a private area so I didn‚Äôt feel uncomfortable out infront of the whole gym. <text>I got scammed with the personal trainer contract by Jose Deoleo.

I didn't do my research. I came asking for someone to teach me kettlebells, I signed a six month contract with Jose Deoleo the first day I walked into the building. Stupid me.

I didn't know which certifications to ask for. I should have asked for SFG or RKC certification. A one day "introduction to kettlebells for personal trainers" certification is not acceptable, and most trainers didn't even have that.

My first trainer didn't have any kettlebell certification, and quit a month after my contract started. I went through four more trainers. The only trainer that seemed remotely qualified to train kettlebells was unreliable (repeatedly cancelled the day of) and quit one month after I started training with him.

When one trainer cancelled a session I called EOS every day for a week asking why my trainer cancelled and asking for my trainer or for the head trainer to call me. Never got a call back. One day I finally got the head trainer, Jose Deoleo. I learned that my trainer had quit, and no-one told me.

A different potential trainer, at our first meeting, without doing any exercise before,  brought me into the restroom and told me to remove clothing so that he could take measurements and criticize my body composition. That's not cool. That's creepy. I told him that day that I did not want to train with him, but folks, for your own wellbeing, don't let a trainer take you into the restroom.

The head trainer, Jose Deoleo, said that he would hold me to the letter of my contract. No outs for trainers quitting or for me requesting a lofty certification like SFG or RKC, or for trainers being creepy. I had signed a contract.

Jose Deoleo tricked me. I fell for it. Stupid me.

Rotten experience.<//text>< Pictures>

James Erikson</user_name>
<Time>1590323997043</Time>< Resp>
None<//Resp>
<pics>None<//pics>< review>
NEVER get an alignment done here, including their other big store.

I've had it done to 2 of my cars, and my father in law has had it done to about 4 of his cars.

Every single time, it's never right. I don't know if they're lazy, or they only do the front, or just let it sit there and hope you won't notice it's the same. Either way, it's never right! I've had it done at numerous places and it's always perfect, but here, it'll always be lacking!

They'll never give you the printout. Probably so you have nothing to hold against them... And if you happen to convince them to give you one, they'll print out a similar car with a super old date on it and hope you don't notice that either.

I recently had 4 new tires put on my car, and while they were nice and even price matched, they once again ripped me off on the alignment. I don't know why I even bother after all the times that they haven't gotten it right!

Probably just going to have to take the loss of money because I'm sure they won't refund me and I'm sure they won't fix it right (they never do), so oh well. Sucks to be them because I have 2 more cars that need all brand new tires but I'll be going elsewhere.</review>

<Date>1382638721073</Date><gmapID>0x80946631b14bf3eb:0xed043ee185bd38bf<//gmapID><text>Called for my wife today to get pricing info for a manicure, and I was given an  approximate range of what it could be. When I tried to get a more specific answer, I was told that different stylists charge different amounts.
I don't know much about the nail / salon business, but my wife, who is from New York, knows just about everything. She explained to me that this salon apparently practices a "charge by the book-cover" pricing policy.
I know what that means. For those who don't, it means that if you look like money, you are charged appropriately. It also means that if the buyer happens to be of a background the seller doesn't like, the buyer is charged a race-fee.
The FBI refers to this criminal act as "Price Gouging," and it is a felony.
Buyer Beware...<//text>< Response>

<Resp>None</Resp><Text>I've taken surf lessons in multiple cities from multiple groups and Kapowui was by far the best.

We went over all the foundations from what part of the surfboard is what, and how to stand on it/turn to mastering each part of the pop up before getting into the water. Then, when we did, surfing was much easier for me than ever and it felt like second nature.

The staff is also so friendly that even people on the beach who weren't taking a lesson with them and asked them questions got answers and they couldn't have been happier to help.

<user>110384464545364573147< /user>< Name>
LORI LEWIS<//Name>
<date>1619552609955<//date>< Rate>
4<//Rate>
< text>
My son had been wanting to do surfing lessons for quite some time and we were finally able to fly out of Houston and head to California for him to enjoy some beach time. Todd and Claudio were great instructors and really took the time to make sure my son, who is only 9, felt comfortable with the movements and made sure that it was a good birthday experience for him. Even when my son got frustrated trying to get the movements down in the sand, they continued to work with him until he got it right. His first time riding the waves, he stood up on his surfboard and rode it all the way to the shore! Their energy and positivity was great and you can tell that with all of the employees, helping people have the best surfing experience possible really is their passion. The only part I was bummed about was the purchase of the GOPRO. Once we received the SD cards, the files were corrupted, BUT when I brought this to the owners attention he immediately offered a number of solutions and gave me a refund for the hassle. The next time I am in California I am definitely going to book with them again!</text>

< text>
I've taken 3 lessons with Kapowui so far (once with Liam and twice with Todd) and my surfing experience has been super awesome every time. The instructors have a lot of knowledge to share about the waves and how to surf. <GmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9< /GmapID><text>I'm super happy I chose this location to do my surfing training!! Todd and Marjan were absolutely amazing!! Marjan made sure I got the best price deal I could get and she went out of her way to do so! Todd was such an amazing and informational instructor I left him a tip! (which is not required) but it goes to show how helpful, patient, and full of great energy he was! I purchased the go-pro to have clipped onto my surfboard. You will need a card reader to watch your shots but I'm excited to have actual footage. I even managed to catch more than 4 or 5 waves which, for a beginner, is freaking awesome! I learned how to paddle as well. I'm from North Carolina but whenever I visit I Will certainly be coming again and again! - E !<//text><user_id>108222102779295266671</user_id>< date>

< Review>
I chose Kapowui based on all the 5 star reviews and now I have to give them 5 more stars! We really enjoyed our lesson. It was easy to find the van and there was lots of parking available. Instructor Clay made sure we had the mechanics down on the beach and then helped us get going in the water, telling us when to go. Neither one of us was any good at it, but he was very patient with us. We were first-timers and had no idea how exhausting and hard surfing is, but we had so much fun! I really give it a 10/5 and I 100% plan to take a lesson with them again next time I'm in the area!< /Review>

<Date>1606677615086</Date>< Text>
My kids (12 and 15) and their cousins (13 and 16) took a two hour lesson from Conner and Todd.  Three of the teens were still beginners, having had only a couple lessons in the past.  They spent 30-40 minutes getting gear and then walking through the surf steps on the beach before getting in the water.  They had a blast - all managed to ride some waves, being pushed into wave by the instructor.  Were having so much fun they asked to stay for an extra hour (which we did).  More experienced teen rode waves with Conner for a couple hours and got good tips on how to improve and read the break.  Great communication with Martin (on site leader) and Marjan (phone & email ahead of time).  Easy location to find, tons of gear to use.  In fact, kids were able to try different boards, to see which ones were easier based on their size and balance.  Would highly recommend!  Maholo!</Text>

< text>
We had a perfect overall experience with Kapowui for our 2 person lesson this weekend. The directions for arrival were clear and when we arrived at 6:20 they were already there, ready to go, so we got started right away. I‚Äôm a total first timer and our instructor Liam was fantastic. His instruction on the beach was interesting and helpful, and then once we got in the water he was like a surf instructor guardian angel üòÇ The waves were a bit rough and coming in really quickly after each other so getting out through them was challenging, but Liam basically pushed us through them when we needed it to help us get to where the waves were breaking and make sure we didnt get too exhausted to have fun. And we did have so much fun. He pushed us off into good waves and told us when to pop up, then later helped us figure out what to do differently if we had fallen the last time. The amount of work your instructor does out in the water for you is insane so trust me this is not overpriced. (Don‚Äôt forget to tip!) Definitely want to go again.</text>

First time surfing. Had a great experience with this surf school and my instructor, Alex, was a really great guy; probably one of the best instructors I have met. I got a short introduction to the surfboard and did some practice on land, and then the party started. <user>106619199017117086497</user>< name>
Steve Michel<//name>
<date>1582939316550< /date><Rate>5</Rate>< review>
I had a great experience learning how to surf with Madeline at Kapowui Surf Lessons. I had never surfed before so I was a little nervous going into it but by the end I was hooked and can‚Äôt wait to try it again. We started with a lesson on the sand to learn the four steps to getting into the surf position. We repeated it a number of times and received feedback from Madeline about how to improve. She made sure the three of us in the lesson had a good understanding and were able to perform the moves before we went into the water. In the water she would help us catch the wave and indicate when we needed to stand up. This was helpful so we could focus on applying the techniques that we learned on the sand. Again Madeline provided feedback after each time and was very easy going making it a more enjoyable experience. We had a blast and I look forward to the next lesson.</review>

<UserId.>104443030967167119126</UserId.><name>Abhigna Mandavilli</name>< date>
1581283824505< /date>
< Rate>
5< /Rate>
<review>TL;DR: Kapowui is the real deal! Ultimate value for money, personalized instructions, surfing at a no-crowd part of the beach, and detailed feedback at every step, resulting in quick progress and a great experience.

The Details:

A little bit of background before I go into the details of my experience with Kapowui. As of the date of posting this review, I had been surfing for 3-4 months but was never able to fully ride a green wave (face of an unbroken wave). I had taken a couple of lessons at another surfing school, but my experience was far from satisfactory. Neither did I get the private lessons I had been promised, nor did I get detailed feedback. I decided to try out Kapowui after looking at reviews, and I wish I had started out with Kapowui in the first place.

Martin, the owner, was extremely friendly and asked me to try out a class first and then decide if I wanted to sign up for a package deal. My first class was with Gregory (Greg) aka G-Force. He is a highly experienced surfer  and an exceptional instructor (15+ years experience teaching). He corrected some bad practices I had picked up, and had me surfing green waves within 30 minutes!

After that experience, I decided to sign up for 5 classes at once, and took another class with Greg. I felt like I had taken some big strides in terms of my surfing ability, and was able to catch green waves more consistently.

Another big plus is that Kapowui is located near a beach that is near-secluded in the off-season, so you don't have to worry about being hit by oncoming surfers. It's a lot more relaxing when you focus on the surfing part, which is difficult as it is.

If you are looking for that one-off experience as a tourist, or looking to crank your skills up a notch, Kapowui is the place you want to be.<//review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< Response>
None</Response>

<review>Very professional approach.  Great website. They park their cool 60s Volkswagon van at the parking entrance as a nice visual intro (can't miss them).  They supply the boards and wetsuits, a discount for multiple people, but most importantly excellent instruction.  Blake taught my two daughters land drills for the prone position, a lunge move to get upright, and balance tips.  He offered great descriptive and prescriptive feedback when either daughter needed adjustments and encouragement.  This takes about 1/2 hour, so I suggest signing up for the 1.5 hour session to give you a full hour in the water.  He promised both girls would succeed in getting up and riding some waves.  He was right. One daughter caught on and had multiple successes.  He continued working hard with the other daughter until she got up and rode a solid wave all the way in. Blake showed patience throughout with a pleasant demeanor and comforting approach. I would suggest him, but I am sure Martin would only hire excellent instructors so you will do well with whoever instructs you.  Thanks Blake and Martin.

<user_id>104881735463617772667<//user_id>< Review>
Very good place to get a lesson! They have a cool team working there and are very helpful with any questions, surf or non-surf related. I started with little surfing experience. Ive wake surfed before but this was a lot different. I was able to get up on the board and ride a few waves into shore by the end of the lesson. That was the same for the other two individual that took the class, except neither of them had any type of surf experience. They are affordable and actually offer cheaper options if you do a group lessons. The Kapowui team definitely set me up for surfing success! ü§ôüèªLastly, I want to mention that i was able to take my skills gained from this experience and rent a board in Santa Cruz, WITHOUT the need of another lesson, and had loads of fun!< /Review>

I had my lesson with Corey Biggs last week.  He was an awesome instructor.  I highly recommend.  He really helps you to learn the basics on land to make sure you're prepared for when you head out into the water.  I tried surfing a times on my own before taking the class with him but i really had a hard time standing up on the board and being able to enjoy surfing.  With Corey's help and the new techniques he taught me I was able to stand up on a lot of the waves in the class.  I had so much fun i went and grabbed my surfboard after the class and continued surfing.  It was such a night and day difference.  I could catch most of the waves and ride them to shore!!!!  It was so much fun and i didnt want to stop.  I highly recommend Corey Biggs and the Kapowui surf school.  They will get you riding and loving the waves!!!!</review>

<Name>clayton Weber</Name><date>1596140291773< /date><rate>5< /rate><Review>Tood showed us how to shred the gnar today during our surfing lessoning. Definitely worth our morning. Check them out ü§ôüèº</Review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< resp>

<gmap_id>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9</gmap_id></record>
</dataset><record>
<user>100121273631712031857<//user><username>Liliana Isella<//username><date>1597438069963</date>< Rate>
5< /Rate>
< text>
Surfing class at Kapowui is the perfect mix between our Beach-Boys based, bleached-blonde fantasy of California surfing and the actual, real, raw athletic effort that any sport requires.
In my first class with lovely Haylee we began with learning on the sand the basic four technical steps that take any surfer (including Patrick Swayze in Point Break) from flat belly down on the board to up on your feet riding the hurricane of your life.
But no, once in the water, I rode no hurricanes and I definitely did not look‚Äîneither feel‚Äîlike the female version of Swayze. Well, the pink-shaded waves of this sunny yet impalpable California dawn did feel like hurricanes to my inexperience, though, especially each time I fell off the board even before hitting step four, the one that actually places your feet on the board, your upper body all the way up and your eyes into your freedom (the moment when the fun is supposed to begin, basically).
One time (maybe three, but two of them count only as a rehearsal), with the assistance and the direction of Haylee, for a few seconds that felt like a serendipitous eternity, I was actually able to catch, feel and maintain my balance and ride my personal Friday morning's hurricane (probably the most peaceful wave ever in the history of the entire Pacific Ocean). And, that really felt like an accomplishment! Another accomplishment was when I started understanding what I was doing wrong, like when I was leaning too much forward (and therefore falling into the water even before standing up on the board) or when I was trying to get up and catch the wave too soon or too late (and, by doing that, I was completely missing the momentum and the physical and spiritual connection with the wave).
But, above all, it's the intimacy with the ocean, that I enjoyed the most. Since I took a semi-private class, while Haylee was working with the other student, I had long moments on my own. As I had just been taught to always place my board's nose (yeah, that's how they call it) toward the horizon (Haylee was pretty clear about the surfer's etiquette in the water!), I could breath in the mysterious dissolution of that blue far end-line while receiving the gift of the most magical dance choreographed by a family of silver fishes (I swear I never saw one single fish in the ocean, before) and admiring the million dollar flight of the immeasurably powerful yet gracefully humble seagulls.
Indeed a blessed experience, this first surf lesson, thanks to the professionalism of the Kapowui's team and my teacher Haylee's training tips and health-safety supervision.
Heading back home to get the sand off my feet, now. Listening to a Beach Boys' song, of course!</text>

<userid>100539462898844472722<//userid><username>Bobby Fam< /username><time>1565468412988</time><rate>5</rate>< text>
I highly recommend Kapowui to anyone who wants to take surf lessons in the LA area.
I live in LA and have tried a few other surf lesson providers in the area.  I've also gone surfing a few times with local guides on tropical vacations.  The quality of instruction and positive vibes at Kapowui far exceeds the local competition.  I find myself enjoying the lessons with Kapowui at Venice just as much as I have enjoyed my surf sessions in the tropics (and they don't have the help of 80 degree water and gently peeling reef breaks).
So far I have taken 15+ lessons with Kapowui.  I can feel progress after each session.  All of the instructors give sound advice and quality tips while also maintaining a fun atmosphere.  Recently I've had more sessions with Carl, and he's really helped me improve a lot.  I also recommend Todd and Ryan.
In summary, go surfing with Kapowui! It'll be fun!<//text>

< review>
Kapowui surf school is the best! I have never gone surfing before and I couldn‚Äôt have picked a better company to learn from! While scheduling our lesson online my friend mentioned we were absolute beginners and we got matched up for a lesson with Harry. First, Harry made sure we were all comfortable during the land portion. He expertly explained the different components of the board and gave us a quick class on ocean conditions. Next during the practical portion he encouraged us and gave us feedback on our form after every wave we rode. I felt safe having him as a teacher and under his instruction my friends and I all managed to get up on board by ourselves! It was a truly incredible experience and I now feel like I have the knowledge to go out and try surfing by myself. I will definitely be renting my equipment from the Kapowui school in the future! Highly recommend this place!<//review>

<Review>Had an excellent 2-person lesson with Carl then came back a second day to rent equipment and practice more.  Carl, who is a competitive surfer, taught the fundamentals beach side then assisted in the surf.  Thanks to his help and instruction I was able to stand multiple times and ride some waves from break to beach.  It was a fun and exhilarating experience.   Don't expect to hang ten the first time out but what a fun sport to take on.  Surfing is like life, you try, you fall down, you succeed now and then, and you keep climbing back on for more. Reuben was an awesome instructor! Ive been surfing for 8 years summer months in NY for most of my life. He asked first what my skill level was, checked my pop up stance and proceeded to throw me in water to guage what I needed work on. He was super insightful, knowledgeable and awesome on the board(he almost got pitted). He would show me his style and thought process on how he would catch a wave. I highly recommend him to anyone who's planning to try this school out that is at any skill level. You wont go wrong!<//Text>

We took a group of 14 people out and everyone had a such a great experience- I would highly recommend booking with them! < review>
I had a 1.5 hour 8 AM lesson with Ed. He was great! We covered the various parts of a surfboard and their purpose, why exactly we were going to be surfing where we were, how to get to the surfer pose, and the safety aspects of surfing. All of this was one-on-one and done at a pace that covered everything thoroughly and left plenty of time in the water.

I felt that Ed is genuinely happy to see his students do well. He celebrated along with me when I rode my first wave! I can't recommend Kapowui highly enough!< /review>

<rate>5< /rate>< Text>
Kapowui surf school is super welcoming, friendly, and helpful. There's been detailed instructions before the class and plenty of reminders to help me not forget to set an alarm lol. When we got to the beach, their van is really easy to find.
Our instructor Colston was very knowledeable, and provides really helpful and detailed instructions. In order to help us catch a wave, he kept moving along the beach to find nice and easy waves, and also exchanged some bigger surf boards so it was easier to maintain balance. Eventually my friend and I both caught a wave by the end of the lesson! It was really fun and we're definitely down to surf again.< /Text>

< user>
107099240566199158785<//user>
<name>Sonya M Shafer</name>< Date>
1535915821892< /Date>
<Rating>4<//Rating>< text>
Overall, the instructor was attentive and clear. This was a private lesson for 2 people who had never surfed before for 2 hours. We went early enough that we weren't really competing for space in the water, which made the first half of the experience good. In the second hour another instructor with 4 or 5 people joined us and it felt a bit crowded. The other instructor was barking out orders at his group, drill sergeant style. The experience felt authentic, though when we returned to the van, the instructor was rushed into his next lesson, which didn't feel personable at all. He was told to get some water and we hand shook and were sent off. He was good and knew how to act/what to say when the waves were rough to keep us calm. When I booked the lesson, I took the time to review each instructor, and chose the specific one I wanted, on purpose. I chose Lulu and wanted to surf with her, but when we got there, it was somebody else, without warning. He was good, though not what I paid the $220 for. If you go, go early, and don't bet 100% that you will get the instructor you've chosen, if you took the time to do your research.</text>
< Pics>
None< /Pics>
< response>
{'time': 1535918542060, 'text': "Sonya, as to your 1st issue, about there being to many people in the water, we are allowed  by the city to do our lessons in a specific permitted Zone so we and there are many sand bars, rips, swimmers,  and other hazards the instructor has to take into account to insure your are in the safest and best area. Issue 2, barking instructor,  each instructor has his own teaching style. Issue 3, lesson finishing and you not thinking it was personable,  we book our lessons back to back especially in the summer on a Saturday , so the instructors can maximize their income for the year since this is a seasonal job and they have 5 months to make their money for the year. I'm not sure what you expected your instructor to do after the lesson was over. Each instructor has multiple jobs requirements other than just doing lessons, so getting water is necessary so we can clean wet suits between lessons. We have had multiple instructors quit recently due to burn out and I should have been at the beach to help out but I had my own issues. Issue 4,  you not getting the instructor you booked online, Lulu quit so there was no way for you to get her, and as it clearly states on my website you are not guaranteed the instructor you book online. Sounds like the instructors did everything they were suppose to do.  I'm sorry we didn't meet your expectations. It's reviews like this that really bum me out."}< /response>

5< /Rate>
<Review>Booked a 2 hour surf lesson with Travis on Friday the 3rd of May. Never been surfing before so I was a little bit nervous but needn't have been.
The guys could not have been more welcoming and my instructor Travis could not have been more helpful and engaged.
The surf lesson started off with a pod of dolphins swimming close off shore and just got better from there.
Travis had me standing up on my first wave on my second attempt and I had just an awesome time for the next 2 hours.
My only regret was I left this lesson till the last day of my holiday. If I had a few more days I would have been back.
Would recommend Kapowui to anyone looking to learn how to surf and get some of that Californian surfing spirit.< /Review><Pics>None< /Pics>< Resp>

<date>1565119941417< /date>< review>
Incredible experience with The Kapowui gang!! Had a 90min lesson with Travis who improved my knowledge and helped improve my skill set so much!! Had a group session booked for the next day but since it was all beginners they called up Clay and he showed up (even tho he had the morning off to sleep in!) and he came to do a private lesson with me so we could work going down the line. Clay and Travis were both very kind and knowledgeable. Martin, the owner made sure my quick weekend trip was full of waves, fun and a super chill staff to hang with. Super easy to find the adorable vans in front of the beach and they set you all up. All the staff asked numerous times if I had any additional questions or anything else I wanted to try. Extremely helpful and I learned SO much! Uber will drop you off right in front of the vans, like a 50ft walk. I‚Äôll be going back any time I‚Äôm in Venice for sure! Can‚Äôt say enough great things about the Kapowui crew! Go catch some waves!</review>

<Text>Kapowui was one of the best experiences I've had with a business, everyone I spoke to made me feel welcome. Took my first ever surf lesson with Ruben, and could not recommend him enough. Would also recommend the GoPro package.

I took the 2 hour lesson, which felt like a perfect length. I thought I might spend quite a bit of time on the beach going over the basics, but Ruben got me in the water and on waves super quickly.

Every time I fell, he'd point out one thing to try and focus on for the next run, and it would make such a difference each time. We would tackle simpler waves to nail down the new points, and every now and again he'd throw me more of a challenge, which usually resulted in me falling over but that's how you learn. By the end of the session, was standing up the whole way to the sand, even if i was a little wobbly. I've always wanted to try surfing, and could not stop smiling all morning.

It's very clear Martin (the owner) takes great care in choosing all his instructors, you'll have a fantastic experience with any of them.< /Text><Response>{'time': 1562181962046, 'text': 'Thank you so much Kevin for taking the time and writing this review for us we really do appreciate it!\nIt was a real pleasure having you come for the lesson with us\nAnd we really hope to have you come surfing with us again üôèü§ô'}</Response></record>

<GmapID>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9</GmapID>< Text>
I signed myself and two of my good friends up for a group surfing lesson (Kapowui does group lessons at discounted rates!) and I am so glad I chose them. First of all, they have the coolest surfer van with rentable surfboards and wetsuits of varying sizes for everyone, and the parking was not difficult nor expensive at the time that we went (early morning on Sunday).

I was the only true beginner at the lesson, my two girlfriends had surfed before in the past, but both of them said afterwards that the instruction was very enlightening and made it that much better and easier to surf with success; they learned a lot. All three of us were standing on our boards and able to surf toward the shore on some whitewashes in no time :) Todd was our awesome teacher and he spent the first 30 minutes of our 2 hour session just explaining basic physics of the board and ideal positioning and technique to get up on the board, and then the full 1.5 remaining hours we were just in the water. I really appreciated his sincere and supportive attitude as a teacher! We also met Martin and his chill Cavalier King Charles Spaniel and both he and Todd just had the best vibes. Good people.

If you want to learn to surf I couldn‚Äôt give you a stronger recommendation to go with them! They are the best and I am so inspired to keep at it :) thank you Kapowui üôèüèª<//Text>

<text>The instructor with the blonde hair and blue eyes who told us from she was from another country. Compared me to another on the group lesson saying I wasn't as flexible as my counterpart and later yelled at me the whole entire lesson in the water stating I'm not doing what I'm supposed to do so it made it more mentally challenging while I observed the other instructors not yelling at their customers wishing to be in their group.  I was disappointed because this was the one activity in Santa Monica, California I was looking forward to doing....learning to surf.< /text>< Pics>
None< /Pics>
<Resp>{'time': 1564574871639, 'text': "Hi Venessa, this is Martin the owner of kapowui. I'm very sorry and disappointed that you left feeling this way. I really wish you would have talked to me before you left and then I could have addressed your issues in person. Your instructor, Nofar thought you loved your lessons, because you seemed so happy and stood up so much, she was actually shocked that you left with out leaving a tip that's how certain she was  you had a great time.  I've talked to Nofar and found out what happened. As far as comparing you to the other person in your lessons, it was not to make you feel uncomfortable it was just stating facts and  explaining to you why you were learning a different techinque than the other guy in your lesson. Because you were less flexible than the guy so she had to personalize your pop up technique to accommodate your inflexibility and body type. She did this so you would have a chance of standing up, and it worked, you stood up multiple times. Just to let you know there are many ways to teach a the pop up, one way does not work for all people, so we match the technique to the individual, otherwise only 50% of our lessons would stand up compared to 100%.  As far as yelling at you in the lesson, Nofar would never do that in a mean way. What you have to realize is she's trying to give you feedback on every wave so you can progress and learn as much as possible in the short time we have with you. So every time she pushes you in a wave she watches you till you fall so she can give you feed back on what you did wrong and she needs to do this immediately before she forgets what and this must be done over cacophony of crashing and breaking waves. So you are right she was yelling, but only so you could hear her, not because was mad, frustrated, or disappointed in you. I hope this helps you understand more about what transpired during your lesson and ease any disappointment you have felt. Perhaps now with this new knowledge and understand you can look back with fond memories of your lesson. I'm not going to ask you to change your review but now that you have a better understanding of what happened I hope you reconsider your review score. Lastly I'm really bummed out you left feeling this way, if you are ever back in town stop by and I'll talk to you in person and we'll see what we can do to make your next lesson live up to your expectations. Sincerely Martin."}</Resp>< gmap_id>

Roland Zaglauer<//name>

<UserId.>112411738550995196690</UserId.><user_name>Katalin Torok</user_name><date>1506122636012</date><Rating>5</Rating>< Text>
Words cannot begin to describe how cool and memorable my experience with Kapowui has been! If you are looking for a genuinely fun and potentially life changing experience in Southern California, this is your place!

I live in the middle of Europe, with the closest beach an 8 hour drive from my home, so surfing ocean waves is a HUGE step out of the comfort zone for me. Despite having no experience whatsoever with any board sports, no knowledge of waves or anything remotely related to surfing, my instructor, Will had me catching several cool waves and riding them all the way to the beach within about 40 minutes of arriving at the beach!

We started with a beach lesson where I was shown what to do, proper technique, and given safety advice, and then we headed into the water. After a couple of falls, I started catching waves really fast. The instructor stands with you in the water and helps catch your first waves, gives pointers on what to do different next time to improve, so it is a quick learning curve and very very gratifying. Having had zero previous experience, it was an unbelievably cool feeling to be able to stand up and ride a wave so quickly.

I was hooked instantly, so actually went back for a second lesson during my short stay in LA. I really recommend you do that too, as the second time your body already has some memory of this new activity and the experience is even more gratifying! I was catching waves with more confidence the second time!

All the guys I met at Kapowui, Will, my awesome instructor, Martin, the owner, and the other instructors too, everyone was super friendly and nice. They are also very flexible with scheduling your lesson, and actually recommend the best time on that particular day, checking tides, etc.

Anytime I am in LA in the future, I will be there at the beach catching waves with these guys! You got a new lifetime customer, and what is even cooler, a new fan of surfing! <3

One more note about why I wrote ‚Äúpotentially life-changing experience‚Äù above. It truly has been that for me. Surfing for the first time last week with Will turned out to be a huge lesson on my own fitness level (actually, lack thereof), my ability to face setbacks and my fears (getting washed out by a huge wave is terrifying at first‚Ä¶ and then you cope with it‚Ä¶because you have to - how many times do you get to practice that within a one-hour timeframe?). These two sessions with Kapowui have actually opened up my mind and heart to several new goals to work toward in life‚Ä¶ an unexpected, but very welcome bonus not mentioned on Kapowui‚Äôs website. :)

Thank you soooo much guys, I will be back! :)

P.S.: one more thing‚Ä¶ a day after my lesson I sat at the beach looking at a bunch of guys trying surfing for the first time, being instructed by someone obviously not trained to do so (probably a friend or volunteer). They caught exactly zero waves in the one hour or so, and left tired but frustrated by the experience. As I mentioned, I have zero knowledge of surfing, yet even I could tell from a distance that they were sitting at the wrong spot in the water, and not shown properly what to do and when. They should have saved themselves the frustration and get a lesson with Kapowui instead! :)

See you Kapowui, very soon! <3<//Text>

<UserId.>109938032829970432504< /UserId.><Name>Garrett Meier< /Name><time>1496087223702<//time><Rate>5<//Rate><text>Had an awesome experience with Kapowui. Surfing was on the bucket list so my girlfriend and I researched the best place to take lessons within 20 miles of Marina Del Rey. Kapowui had the best reviews online so we booked two, 2 hour lessons on a weekend. The hype going in didn't disappoint because I don't know how we could have had a better experience!

Mike was awesome from start to finish. We were able to get up by the end of day one (which was a blast to do), and by the end of day 2 we were both paddling and getting up on our own. It was just what we were looking for! Mike knew exactly how and when to push us to continue getting better and having fun. And he was a solid guy!

After two days, I'm hooked! We're both going out this week to buy our own boards to keep up the new hobby!< /text><pictures>None<//pictures>< resp>

<name>cathy poston</name><response>None<//response><Gmap_id>0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//Gmap_id><user_id>113969804065010247836< /user_id></record></dataset><record>

< review>
Having never done any board sport before, I was a bit nervous about trying to surf, but after reading tons of positive reviews I decided to go for it. And let me tell you, I'm beyond glad I did. Taking a surf lesson with Jay was one of the best experiences I could possibly recommend to anyone in the area looking to learn to surf, and really just enjoy themselves on the water. The lot was really easy to find, especially with the VW buses right by the entrance. Throughout the lesson, Jay was super genuine and friendly, and really helpful- giving feedback on every wave for how to do better on the next one. I had a great time, and I'll absolutely return for another lesson the next time I'm in town.</review>

< review>
I had an awesome experience with my private lesson with Kapowui. I didn't pick a particular instructor and trusted them to pair me with the best one based on my experience for my lesson. I worked with Leon for 2 hours and it was amazing, we joked that we should just book another 4 to keep going! As I had surfed before and was moving onto green waves (unbroken) I was super stoked to have a 1:1 and conquer the next phase. Leon's instructions were clear and his coaching was very encouraging. We did a lot of laughing, hanging, and catching waves and it was exactly what I needed. I was definitely bummed to see the 2hours end. He's among my top 2 surf instructors/experiences to date. Highly recommend.<//review>

His instructions were clear and his sense of humor was infectious! He kept things light, uplifting, and positive from beginning to end which is rare in any style of coaching. They were both up on their boards in no time. Luke and Tucker will remember California surfing from a true surfer forever! Thanks for playing such a great part in our trip from Alabama!<//Review>

< name>
Matthew Beirouti</name>
< date>
1458200185986</date>
<rating>5<//rating>< text>
One of the best decisions I made while visiting Venice Beach. Awesome name with awesome people. Marty and Kenny were both friendly and helpful! I wanted to learn how to surf for the first time and was kind of hesitant to go with an instructor from one of the other equipment rental shops. While walking along the front walk, my eye caught this beautiful orange van in a parking lot, stacked with colored boards.

I met Marty who explained to us that since the weather was suboptimal that morning, he would be robbing us of money if he gave us a lesson. Instead he proposed a day and time when he knew the ocean would be more forgiving and offered to take us then. I really appreciated Marty's integrity. I set up two lessons with Kenny, one of Marty's instructors whom I had the pleasure of meeting.  He was very friendly and gave us valuable instruction and trooped through some pretty rough waves to teach my buddy and I. This guy is top notch. My buddy caught waves on the first day and I caught quite a few more on the next, when the waters were a little lighter. Kapowui had great equipment, and Marty let us use his GoPro to take some awesome videos!

My trip to Venice Beach was made amazing thanks to Marty and Kenny. I highly recommend Kapowui!< /text>

< Text>
I have been meaning to write this for a while, because these people are so incredible and have given me the greatest gift - SURFING!

I started going to Kapowui in August and I have since started venturing out on my own (thanks to how much I learned from taking lessons here), however I find an excuse to go back and visit the Kapowui folks pretty much EVERY weekend because they are so great.  Martin is the absolute best, along with every one of the instructors working at Kapowui, and I have surfed with pretty much everyone!  They are SO passionate about surfing, and care very much about equipping you with the skills and training that you need to excel at the sport.  They will always be honest with you about the conditions, and whether or not they work well with your skill level.  Not to mention, everyone that works here has encyclopedic knowledge about surfing.

I cannot thank Martin and everyone at Kapowui enough for all the time they have spent with me, both in the water, but also answering all of my surf related questions, and generally just being supportive of me as a surfer newbie.

I also want to say that I have taken lessons at other surf schools in the area, and no one has held a candle to the level of passion and commitment and thoroughness that I have seen at Kapowui. Whether you have never surfed before, or you are a beginner/intermediate surfer looking to get some extra instruction and improve your skill set, or maybe just looking to rent a board and suit- GO HERE.  You will not be disappointed!</Text>

< gmap_id>
0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//gmap_id>
< Text>
First time surfers, had a blast!  We were lucky enough to get Jeremie as an instructor, he was friendly, experienced, chill and has great teaching technique.  I really appreciated his no-nonsense instruction:  we were out on the water quicker than I anticipated and our 2-hour (2-people) lesson was non-stop fun!!  I didn't think I would get up in the first hour, but was standing up on my second wave!  The instruction and lesson  felt safe, which added to confidence and thus made for a great time with no stress.   I know that people may hesitate on the price (all the surf schools are about the same cost, btw) but when you think a night out with a bottle of wine and a really nice meal costs about the same.  This was a great deal more fun and we will certainly remember it much longer than a meal out, so dollars well spent!  We felt so good afterwards and spent the rest of the afternoon walking around Venice and back to the Pier.  I would recommend Kapowui for a spectacular experience to anyone.  Travel tip:  take the Expo Train out to Santa Monica and walk down Ocean Front.  It wasn't much longer than driving from downtown LA (45 minutes) and saves $$ for parking as well as the environment :)<//Text>

< Text>
More times than I'd like to admit, I've received service from people with a ton of personality, only to realize they became too comfortable, taking liberties with the way they treated my business. Ex: The tailor you hit it off with, but starts delaying your alterations because he confused your kindness with his cousin's.

It's a shame when you find people with genuine personalities that fail at what you came to see them for.

Jeremie and Martin at Kapowui are able to balance professionalism and great personalities.

If you want to learn how to surf and feel like writing a five star review after you're done, this is the place.</Text>

{'time': 1495364839436, 'text': "Sonya, thank you for taking the time to write us a review! When I first read your review I got so upset to hear about your 1st lesson last year. I only hire the best instructors and train them extensively to be even better. I had to get to the bottom of why you didn't learn much your 1st lesson.I looked through my records to see who did your 1st lesson. His name is Raymond. He is a very good instructors so It didn't make sence.  I did further research to check the condition during your 1st lesson on July 3rd 2016 and that's when I discovered the problem. The surf was HUGE your 1st lesson. When the surf is big it is always going to be much more challenging for the student and the instructor. I take  full responsibility for you not learning much your 1st lesson because I drill it into the instructors head,when the conditions are challenging, the instructors #1 job is to keep the student safe. So I  apologize that you didn't learn much.  Here is a cut and paste of the conditions Last summer\n\nPOSTED: 07/02/16, 8:08 AM PDT\nLOS ANGELES >> Elevated surf and strong rip currents are expected Monday along the coast, creating hazards for swimmers, surfers and boaters on this Independence Day, National Weather Service forecasters said.\n\nSurf of 3 to 5 feet is expected, reaching 7 feet at some south- and southwest-facing beaches, and a beach hazards statement, which is one level less serious than a high surf advisory, will be in effect in Los Angeles County through Monday afternoon and in Orange County through Monday night.\n\nI believe the conditions where the problem with your 1st lesson more so than the instructor. Thank you for giving  us a second chance to redeem your confidence.  I truly appreciate your repeat business and I'm happy you had a good time at your 2nd lesson and plan on coming back. Thank you again,  Martin"}< /Response>

Your request for a 4 hour rental would cost me money to stay open due to my overhead. The hours on my google maps are subject to change daily and is determined by our surf lesson schedule. < Review>
If you are looking for the BEST instructor and surf lessons you need to request Jonny at Kapowui ! My daughter had a 2 hour lesson today and it was a GREAT experience and the highlight of our trip to LA.  She had never surfed before and he had her up right from the start of the lesson and surfing all the way into shore. If we were in town longer we would have definitely signed up for more lessons. His positive energy and enthusiasm is contagious. THANK YOU JONNY!!!!!!< /Review>

< text>
Was in Venice on holiday and saw there cool VW can and decided to swing by and take a lesson (never surfed before). They were all very friendly and I was given a time directly with an instructor named Corry. He had me up and surfing the waves within half an hour. An absolute legend!!! Can't recommend this company enough and Corry! However the other instructors seem awesome as well seriously knowledgeable and friendly.  I ended up booking 3 more lessons with Corry and would have done more if it wasn't for the fact that I'm going home. Booking a trip here next year for surfing!< /text>

106133816955926708649</user>
<name>Ira & Yolanda Murphy< /name><Time>1492357461744</Time><Rate>5</Rate>< Review>
They say you find a way to make a living doing what you love. If this is not a manifestation of that very ideal, I don't know what is. I genuinely forgot that any part of this experience was a business transaction (we literally could recall if we had paid by the end of the session). My husband and my son were first time surfers and the team really cared about that. Their demonstrated awareness of conditions, assertiveness of their clients and overall enthusiasm has made us lifelong members.

Learning to surf with Mike was like sharing life experience with a cousin you had not seen since childhood. The entire staff made us feel like family. I don't think that I could put a fair price on the experience that Mike and the rest of the Kapowui staff gave us as first time surfers. I may even venture to say that we made new friends. There is a valid reason for this company to have achieved five stars across the board...it is a rarity.

Mike, thanks for going the extra mile to warm our little munchkin up to the water. You are an awesome person, instructor and surfer...

#OutOfManyOnePeople #TheMurphys< /Review>
< Pictures>
None< /Pictures>

Your husband and son were truly some of the best people I have ever met, you are a very lucky woman. I loved you husband and sons zest for life and their smiles were infectious. YOU are what gives me hope for the future and YOU are what keeps us going and makes all of our lives so full and blessed. Thank you from the deepest recesses of all our hearts. Juan was our instructor - not only was he helpful and knowledgeable but he's suuuper fun! He'll make you laugh while working with you on your technique. < Review>
This is possibly the best surf school in Venice Beach! A place with great vibes and lots of smiles. The instructors are one big and tightly knit family with many years of surf experience. There is an instructor that fits any learning style and personality. My instructor Eduwardo was the best!  He is the most kind, patient, and thorough; it was my first lesson ever and I felt very safe and assured at all times. The pricing is fair and everything is practically included; just bring a towel and your game. Kapowui's mission is to spread the passion for surfing as well as having a great time.</Review>

<name>Bea Imrie<//name><pics>None< /pics>< time>
1512013121162<//time>
<user_id>102546857415187669707< /user_id><review>If I could give these guys more than 5 stars I would!  I took a lesson here while visiting LA last week and cannot recommend them enough.  They were helpful when I texted them with questions ahead of time (on thanksgiving even!).
This review is going to be long, because I have so many good things to say!
The instructors we met were very friendly and welcoming as we got set up.  Raymond did our lesson, and explained everything clearly and gave us tips and pointers on our form before we even got into the water.  Once we started surfing he set us up for each wave, making sure our timing and speed was right so we could focus on popping up and balancing properly.  He gave us feedback on every wave, and both of us (first time surfers) were able to catch several waves by the end of the lesson.  We could see other lessons from Kapowui happening around us, and it seemed like the other lessons were equally successful. I have heard friends and family try other surfing schools who have given up after fruitless classes, and Kapowui made our experience completely the opposite.
We enjoyed the lesson so much that we went back to rent equipment from them a few days later.  Martin the owner was incredibly helpful; when we weren't sure if we should rent or take another lesson, he suggested we rent and if we changed our minds he would count our rental fee towards the lesson.  Martin was out surfing while we were, and gave us a bunch of pointers even though he had no obligation to.  It is clear he and all the Kapowui instructors are so passionate about surfing and teaching, and the joy they bring to it changes the lives of everyone who passes through.
You have converted two new surfers Kapowui! We are already planning our next trip back to venice to surf with you guys.  Thank you so much for sharing your passion!< /review>< Gmap_id>

< text>
My girlfriend and me were on a USA Roadtrip this Summer. On this trip we wanted to take our very first surf lesson, but we didn't manage to make reservations beforehand. So we thought this dream had to die.
But right before we left LA, we spontaneously stopped by at Kapowui Surf Lessons and although they were all booked out, they somehow made it possible for us to get our private lessons - instantly. This saved our day!
The instructor was very nice and really took his time explaining everything we needed to know. The lesson was very well structured and fun.
Even though it was my first time on a surfboard I managed to stand up on the board and ride the waves without falling down a couple times.
I don't remember the price, but I remember it to be very fair!
Definetely one of our trip's Highlights!</text>

Tony Marchena<//username>
< Text>
I had sooo much fun this morning with Will!!! It was my first time surfing in my entire life, he was soo patient with me even though I kept on falling off the board, he continuously brought soo much energy and positivity with such clear communication on how to correct my form so I could stay upright on the board, and ultimately be able to ride the waves all the way to the end with comfort and confidence, which I did!!! Thanks to Will of course! I couldn't of been any happier with my experience from this morning!!! To anyone out there who wants to try out surfing but is intimidated that they will not be able to get the hang of it right away or not enjoy their surf lesson then you definitely need to check this place out! I promise you won't be disappointed, you'll have soo much fun, you'll love the environment, the clear communication from the instructors, how patient they are, the tremendous amount of positivity and energy they bring, and most importantly you'll definitely be able to learn how to surf if you continue having surf lessons with them! I can't wait until my next lesson! These guys are awesome!!!<//Text>

<Review>Had an amazing time with an excellent instructor. Can‚Äôt wait to go surfing again thanks to the guys at Kapowui.< /Review>< gmap_id>
0x80c2a4c65d2f432b:0x3aaffb088afffde9<//gmap_id>

<user_id>114406861253022673357<//user_id>< name>
Hailee Araya<//name>
< Time>
1503256905599< /Time>
<rate>5<//rate>< Review>
Phenomenal group of instructors.
Me and my gal pal came to LA with intentions of only staying 5 days , then the plan was to go to Vegas for the remaining 5 days.
Long story short, we had our first lesson day 2 and by day 3 we had cancelled Vegas,  extended our stay in Venice beach,bought a package surfing  deal each so we could surf once a day everyday until it was time to head back.
My friend was a natural and was able to pop up on the board day 1.
Me , not so much. I kept trying and kept falling right into the water. Our first instructor Leon (who we had 4 sessions with) then made the observation that  i overshoot when I put my foot up when getting on the board.  I was too far up on the board when I popped up. So he said I'd need to be far back on the board ,more so than others since I have that habit of putting my leg to far forward. And whatddya know, suddenly I was balacing on that board! Amazing correction.
Our 2nd instructor Tod (we wanted to try as many instructors as possible to see what we could take from each one as everyone has their own style and methods) gave me the awesome advice to pop up on the board a bit faster and use my hands to balancs once im up so I'd stay on longer. Amazing feedback as that improved my balance greatly.
Will gave us gorgeous  waves and his ability to time them so they wouldn't be too overwhelming for us was impressive especially since the waves were massive when we went out for our lesson with him. He especially helped me with my fear of getting back into the water with my board which is honestly terrifying to me as I often felt like between the wind, water and sand (that would cement me in the ground) I felt I had little control over my board when getting back into the safe zone past the breaking waves.
I should say that every instructor addressed this fear with me and showed me how to get inside but I felt like I was able to spend more time making sure it stuck with Will in particular.

From day one till my last surfing session today (until I come back next month) myprogress is amazing and a true testament to how great these guys are at their jobs.
And as for my friend,  she's a natural....but can't swim very well. And they had her feeling so brave and taught her exactly how to protect herself in the water - this is a big deal for a girl who is scared of the water.

If you want to learn surfing , this is the group of people to go to. They're super fun, genuinely good people and VERY knowledgeable and skilled in their field.
They will take great care of you.
Thank you for everything guys, see you in September ‚ù§ x< /Review>

<Review>Great teachers and good mood !< /Review></record></dataset><record>
<UserId.>116204073927605218053</UserId.>< Name>
lola doucet<//Name>
<date>1490407156021</date><Rating>5< /Rating><text>We were on an 8-day, 1700 mile whirlwind tour of California/Nevada last week with the family, when we were walking along Venice Beach in the morning before taking off for San Francisco. I was taking a picture of this very cool VW van with surfboards on it, when a guy came over and suggested we take surfing lessons. It put the spark in my partners mind, but i was a little more reserved.  It would completely round out the trip which included skiing in Heavenly, Lake Tahoe, hot springs in the Sierras, Death Valley and the High Roller in Vegas.  But, we didn't have a lot of time before heading to Alcatraz.

The guy, Blake, said he wouldn't be able to take us until later, because the tide was high, but to think about it and let him know if we were interested. We walked a bit, and the surf seemed huge! I never surfed before, and being from Nova Scotia, the waves seemed ginormous.

I was also a little unsure about a surfing outfit running out of a VW van on the beach. Seemed straight out of a novel or a movie. A bit unreal. Were there better options out there? So i took a minute to look through some reviews. Everything seemed good. Lots of great reviews for them, so i said why not?

Blake couldn't take us right away and we couldn't wait much longer because we had to get on the road, so one of the owner's, Marty came in special for us.  As a business owner, that in itself tells me that he's conscientious. And the equipment was clean and in great condition. The wetsuits were even on the top of the van warming up for us.

Then there was the dryland training. They made sure all of our group were ready for the water before we went out. Super safety conscious. Both of them were so positive and experienced that i felt totally safe. The waves were big, but they kept us all sorted out and motivated.  i even got up 5 times!!!

I really can't say enough about Kapowui. If i could give 10 stars out of 5, i would.  It's the real deal. If you are looking for an authentic surf experience at Venice Beach, Marty will give it to you. I'm so glad i took the plunge. It was the highlight of an already pretty epic adventure. Worth every penny!</text>< Pics>
None</Pics>
